sentence.content: Sir Nicholas Lyell QC, the attorney-general, will attempt to stop the curtain rising on Maxwell: The Musical, the West End show chronicling the life and times of the late Robert Maxwell.

sentence.content: Fears that the musical might prejudice the criminal trial of the late publisher&apost;s sons, Kevin and Ian, have prompted Sir Nicholas to apply to the High Court on Monday for an injunction to halt the production.

sentence.content: However, it is no more unprecedented, most lawyers say, than the prospect of the Maxwell brothers having to commute to their trial at the Old Bailey past a theatre advertising the story of their father as &apost;the musical review that will make you laugh, sing - and be angry&apost;.
